dateline.date: Twenty Ninth JanuryCD omitted the second “a” in both “January” and (below) in “alwys”. 1849.

opener.salute: My Dear Mr. Kenyon.John Kenyon (1784-1856; Dictionary of National Biography), wealthy man of letters and philanthropist. Forster called him “our dear friend” (F, III, ii, 210); CD, reviewing their circle to Macready (2 Feb 49), described Kenyon facetiously as “smooth, oily, beaming, and slippery (He is my particular friend...)” (Pilgrim Letters 5, pp.488-9).

body.p: I shall be delighted to come to you on Friday, For dinner, 2 Feb. and book myself accordingly.
